arts.ttl: Wales' World Cup hopes take blow as De Bruyne scores twice
arts.sum: Wales' hopes of automatic World Cup qualification were dealt a blow as Kevin De Bruyne converted two penalties in Belgium's 4-2 win in Cardiff.

arts.ttl: Highlights: De Bruyne stars as Belgium dent Wales' World Cup hopes
arts.sum: Watch the best of the action as Wales lose 4-2 to Belgium in World Cup qualifying in Cardiff.

arts.ttl: Wales player ratings as winger stands out, but too many fall short in Belgium defeat
arts.sum: Here's how the players rated during the 4-2 defeat to Belgium

arts.ttl: Kevin De Bruyne double sinks Wales as Belgium take control of World Cup group
arts.sum: Wales 2-4 Belgium: The Dragons appear to be in a battle for second spot with North Macedonia as Belgium stormed to victory in Cardiff

arts.ttl: Wales 2-4 Belgium: De Bruyne nets penalty brace to dent hosts' qualifying hopes
arts.sum: Wales fell to defeat at home to Belgium at the Cardiff City Stadium

arts.ttl: The results Wales now need after Belgium defeat and World Cup lifeline they have
arts.sum: Wales fell to a home defeat against Belgium, meaning they have an uphill battle in their final two matches of the campaign

arts.ttl: Wales 2-4 Belgium: Kevin De Bruyne scores two penalties as Red Devils come from behind to take charge of World Cup qualifying Group J
arts.sum: Report as Belgium beat Wales in Cardiff; Joe Rodon put Wales ahead but Kevin De Bruynes penalty levelled after Ethan Ampadus handball; Thomas Meunier put Belgium in front before another De Bruyne penalty; Nathan Broadhead made it 3-2 but Leandro Trossard struck

arts.ttl: Wales v Belgium match halted as giant rat invades pitch
arts.sum: The rodent was on the pitch during the crucial World Cup qualifier at Cardiff City Stadium

arts.ttl: LIVE: Wales vs. Belgium in crucial World Cup qualifier
arts.sum: Wales host Belgium in Cardiff in their Group J qualifying match for the 2026 World Cup. Join ESPN for live action.

arts.ttl: Wales v Belgium: World Cup 2026 qualifying – live
arts.sum: Updates from the 7.45pm BST kick-off in Cardiff Live scores: all the goals as they go in | Email Michael Obviously Wales’ performance and result against England last week was disappointing. Craig Bellamy has made no excuses for the defeat: I like pressing and we didn’t press. We were deep, we didn’t get out, we didn’t trigger. Top teams don’t let you get away with it. Looking back through the game, I really enjoyed it. I don’t like the defeat, but there’s a lot to grab and it gives me the feeling this team can go a lot further and that leaves you excited. Continue reading...
